bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Roentgen Ray Society was organized by Charles Lester Leonard as the Roentgen Society of Philadelphia on 2 Feb. 1905. Its objects were to study X-rays and promote professional contact. After Leonard's death, the society was reorganized and became the Philadelphia Roentgen Ray Society on 1 Dec. 1913. Its officers include a president, vice-president, and secretary-treasurer. The society was incorporated in 1929.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of minutes of the Philadelphia Roentgen Ray Society, 1905-1942. Minutes discuss business matters and list papers delivered at scientific meetings of the Society. The collection also includes: voucher book, with checks and receipts, 1925-1927; records relating to incorporation; copies of the societies constitution, by-laws, and membership lists; and materials related to a 1995 presentation on the history of the Society.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Philadelphia Roentgen Ray Society records (MSS 3/0021-01) and Roderick Tondreau collection.
